messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Conference questions
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/25/03 12:34:11 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... It was great and I must say that it was even more spectacular for my boys. For them it was so
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/25/03 12:34:11 PM Eastern Standard Time,
kbcdlovejo@... writes:

> I hope you can make it. "Shot in the Arm" is an understatement! Many said
> last year was life-changing!! (I'll blow my own horn! <G>)
>
>

It was great and I must say that it was even more spectacular for my boys.
For them it was so nice to be with like minded people. Adults not ignoring
them and older children interested in what younger children had to say, even
playing with them. They loved it.
Pam G.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Conference questions
messages.msgSnippet: Oh what a wonderful birthday present it would be for me to be able to go. Half of me would loved to come with the whole family and half of me would love to be
messages.messageBody:
Oh what a wonderful birthday present it would be for me to be able to go.
Half of me would loved to come with the whole family and half of me would
love to be on my own for a weekend but ALL of me would love to get there any
way I could.

I guess I could dream.

Mary B

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Conference questions
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/25/2003 10:34:54 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... Julie, and everybody: I m wary of posting anything I don t know FOR sure. I have an
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/25/2003 10:34:54 AM Eastern Standard Time,
julie@... writes:
> Kelly, what are the dates and what is the location of the
> conference?
> What does it cost?
> How long can I delay making a decision to register?
> I'm going to Paris next fall. I don't know if I could come, but I
> would love to. I think it would be such a shot in the arm.
> Would you post the details all in one post for me? Pretty please?
>
> Julie B
>

Julie, and everybody:

I'm wary of posting anything I don't know FOR sure. I have an appointment
with the hotel on Tuesday morning. If we can work it all out then---iron out
all details, I'll post next week. It will be in Columbia, SC TENTATIVELY
22-24 August 2003 at the Holiday Inn-Coliseum.

Prices aren't set yet---I have to figure out the expenses before I set the
price. I'll make it as reasonable as I possibly can. Last year we had family
discounts and early bird discounts, so the earlier you register, the better
deal you get. That's the plan this year too. Room rates are $79 plus tax, the
same as last year---in a better (and safer<G>) hotel . And kids under 5 eat
free.

Presenters are: S-P-A-M ---Sandra Dodd, Pam Sorooshian, Anne Ohman, and Mary
Gold. <G>

You can check out last year's website (which NEEDS to get hoppin' SOON for
THIS year!) in my sig line.

We welcome dads and children. Non age-discriminatory---although some things
are more age-appropriate than others.(and we'll have a room 'specially for
toddlers this year). And Ben will have some "Dads Only" sessions (at their
request).

I hope you can make it. "Shot in the Arm" is an understatement! Many said
last year was life-changing!! (I'll blow my own horn! <G>)

~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy, Coordinator
Schools Out Support
mailto:coordinator@...
803-776-4849
Fax: 803-776-7006
http://www.schoolsoutsupport.org

Kelly, what are the dates and what is the location of the
conference?

What does it cost?

How long can I delay making a decision to register?

Julie B
